wsdl:definitions.name: WokSearchService
wsdl:definitions.wsdl:documentation: The namespace in the WokSearch Web service version 2 was "http://woksearch.cxf.wokmws.thomsonreuters.com".

xsd:annotation.xsd:documentation: In version 2, the sequence was databaseId, uid, editions, timeSpan, queryLanguage, retrieveParameters. Now the sequence is databaseId, uid, queryLanguage, retrieveParameters. Now the editions and timeSpan elements no longer valid element names.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.

citingArticles, relatedRecords have identical structure (e.g., parameters).

In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 3, this is no longer nillable.

citingArticles, relatedRecords have identical structure (e.g., parameters).

In version 2, the sequence was databaseId, uids, queryLanguage, retrieveParameters. Now the sequence is databaseId, uid, queryLanguage, retrieveParameters.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required. In version 2, the element name was uids.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.

In version 2, the sequence was databaseID, editions, queryLanguage, symbolicTimeSpan, timeSpan, userQuery. In version 3, the sequence is: databaseId, userQuery, editions, symbolicTimeSpan, timeSpan, queryLanguage.
In version 2, the element name was databaseID and minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 3, it is no longer nillable.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, the sequence was: collectionFields, count, fields, firstRecord, options. In version 3, the sequence is: firstRecord, count, sortField, viewField, option.
In version 2, the name was fields and the type was woksearch:queryField. In version 3, it is no longer nillable.
In version 2, the name was collectionFields and the type was woksearch:collectionFields. In version 3, it is no longer nillable.
In version 3, it is no longer nillable.
In version 2, the name of the type was queryField.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, the name of the type was collectionFields.

In version 2, the sequence was collectionName, fieldList and listName. However, listName was ignored. In version 3, the sequence is: collectionName and fieldName. The name fieldList has changed to fieldName. listName is no longer a valid XML element.
In version 2, minOccurs='0'. Now this element is required.
A single fieldName whose value is an empty string, a string of length zero, will return the minimal XML record structure.
In version 2, minOccurs=0. Now this element is required.
In version 2, minOccurs=0 and nillable was not specified (hence, false). Now this element is required and is nillable.

In version 2, the sequence of the elements was options, parent, queryID, records, recordsFound, recordsSearched. In version 3, the sequence is: queryId, recordsFound, recordsSearched, parent, optionValue, records. The name options has changed to optionValue.
In version 2, this element name was queryID. Now it is queryId.
In version 2, this element name was options.
In version 2, this element name was options.
In version 2, this element name was values.
In version 2, this element name was queryID.
In version 2, this element name was records. However, the data within this element is references not source records.
In version 2, the sequence was articleID, citedAuthor, citedTitle, citedWork, page, recID, refID, timesCited, volume, year.
In version 2, this element name was recID. Now recID does not exist.
In version 2, this element name was refID. Now refID does not exist.
In version 2, this element name was articleID. Now articleID does not exist.
In version 2, this element name did not exist.
The FaultInformation is detail for the SOAP fault. This information did not exist in WokSearch version 2. However the Fault did exist.
The code is an identifier for the specific message found in the SOAP Fault faultstring element.
The message is the detail of the code element.
The reason is a more detailed explanation of the message element.

The causeType should be one of "service", "handshake" or "remote". Any other value should be considered "service". If the causeType is "service" then the exception occurred within this Web service. If the causeType is "handshake" then the exception occurred within this Web service while attempting to access a supporting Web service (see the remoteException element for more information on the exception). If the causeType is "remote" then an exception has been sent from a supporting Web service (see the remoteException element for more information on the exception).
The cause is a low-level explanation of the reason for the exception.
The remoteException contains error information from a supporting Web service or while attempting to access a supporting Web service. Also see causeType.
The remedy indicates the action that should be taken on the client side, or requester side, to correct the problem.

The RawFaultInformation is consists of the static message text of the faultstring, message, reason, cause and remedy elements along with the message data used to instantiate the message parameters. Message parameters are of the form {0}, {1}, etc. and conform to the Java 5 java.text.MessageFormat API.
This information did not exist in WokSearch version 2. However the Fault did exist.
The rawFaultstring is the text of the faultstring element without the messageData applied.
The rawMessage is the text of the message element without the messageData applied.
The rawReason is the text of the reason element without the messageData applied.
The rawCause is the text of the cause element without the messageData applied.
The rawRemedy is the text of the remedy element without the messageData applied.

The messageData is the data to be applied to the rawFaultstring, rawMessage, rawReason, rawCause and rawRemedy elements, to create the text of the faultstring, message, reason, cause and remedy element, respectively.
The remoteNamespace is the XML namespace of the supporting Web service.

The remoteOperation is in the form WS.operation, where WS is the name of the Web service and operation is the name of the requested Web service operation. The Web service may or may not be a SOAP Web service.

The remoteCode is the error code returned by the supporting Web service. If this is blank then the supporting Web service did not return a fault message. The error could have occurred while attempting to contact the supporting Web service: look in the handshakeCauseId and handshakeCause.
The remoteReason is the description corresponding to the remoteCode.

The handshakeCauseId is the implementation class name of the exception within this Web service (which may change). If the handshakeCauseId or the handshakeCause exist then an error occurred attempting to access the supporting Web service specified in the remoteOperation element. If there is a remoteCode and/or remoteReason then the handshake error information indicates an exception within this Web service while handling the (error) response message from the supporting Web service. If the remoteCode and remoteReason are empty strings or are not present then the handshake error information corresponds to an exception within this Web service while attempting to send a request to the supporting Web service.
See the annotation for the handshakeCauseId element.
The QueryException indicates that there is an error within the userQuery element in the SOAP request message for the requested operation.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.
The AuthenticationException indicates that there is a problem with the authentication credentials associated with the SOAP request message for the requested operation.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.

The InvalidInputException indicates that format of the SOAP request message is valid XML and that it satisfies the WSDL but that the content, or values found in one or more XML elements, of the SOAP request message for the requested operation is invalid.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.
The ESTIWSException indicates that an exception occurred within this Web service while processing the incoming SOAP request message.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.
The InternalServerException indicates that a supporting Web service encountered an problem while processing the request and returned a general exception message.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.
The SessionException indicates that there is a problem with the session identifier associated with the incoming SOAP request message.
In version 2, the faultInformation and rawFaultInformation elements did not exist. It is not required that the service return these elements.
